content: Revlon's first quarter 2022 as-reported net sales of $480 million represents growth of 8% relative to the prior year quarter with all reporting segments growing. As-reported net sales were $480 million in the first quarter of 2022 compared to $445 million during the prior year period, an increase of $35 million or 8%. As-reported operating income was $24 million in the first quarter of 2022 compared to an operating loss of $13 million during the prior year period, an improvement of $36 million. Revlon segment net sales in the first quarter of 2022 were $182 million, a $20 million increase or 15% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Revlon segment profit during the first quarter of 2022 was $24 million, a $16 million increase or approximately 208% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Elizabeth Arden segment net sales in the first quarter of 2022 were $115 million, a $3 million increase or 4% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Elizabeth Arden segment profit during the first quarter of 2022 was $6 million, a decrease of $3 million or 33% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Fragrances net sales in the first quarter of 2022 were $83 million, a $9 million increase, or 13% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Fragrances segment profit during the first quarter of 2022 was $12 million, a $4 million increase or 49% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period. Portfolio segment net sales in the first quarter of 2022 were $99 million, a $3 million increase or 5% on a constant currency basis over the prior year period. Portfolio segment profit during the first quarter of 2022 was $17 million, a $4 million increase or 35% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior year period.
